data.title: DOM Navigation
data.description: This section outlines techniques for navigating through the Document Object Model (DOM), focusing on how to access and locate various elements within the hierarchical tree structure of HTML documents. It highlights methods to identify parent, child, and sibling relationships among nodes as well as techniques for searching and retrieving elements based on different attributes like tags, classes, or CSS selectors.

items.title: Parent, Child, and Sibling Nodes
items.description: Parent, child, and sibling nodes: The DOM is structured like a tree of nodes. You can navigate this tree using properties like 'parentNode', 'childNodes', and 'nextSibling'.

items.title: Searching the DOM Tree
items.description: Searching the DOM tree: Methods like 'getElementsByTagName()', 'getElementsByClassName()', and 'querySelector()' allow you to search for elements in the DOM based on different criteria, making it easier to manipulate specific elements.
